zone.line: I pictured to myself some a lovely river
such as that on whose banks Dante
describes Mathilda gathering flowers,
which ever flows
––––––– bruna, bruna,
Sotto l’ombra perpetua, che mai
Raggiar non lascia sole ivi, nè Luna.
And then I repeated to myself all
that lovely passage that relates the
entrance of Dante into the terrestrial
Paradise; and thought it would be
sweet when I wandered on those lovely
banks to see the car of light descend
with my long lost parent to be restored
to me. As I waited there in expectation
of that moment, I thought how, of the
lovely flowers that gree grew there,
I would wind myself a chaplet and
crown myself for joy: I would sing
sul’ margine d’un rio, my father’s favourite
song, and that my voice gliding through
the windless air would announce to him
